column4: i have removed kde by the instructions under !puregnome but I still have a Kubuntu loading screen on start up and it takes forever. how do get rid of it?
thats just a usplash graphics i imagine.   its possible some usplash files dident get removed properly
synaptic has a feature to show installed packages
what is it?
thers a button in synaptic to show installed packages.. explore the tool
i dont see it. but thanks anyways
fire up the package manager , search for lxde and  select what you want.  but some apps may try to pull in others.
last i tried the lubuntu-desktop package pulled in a lot of extras i dident want. Not tried just 'lxde' lately
its openbox last i checked.
you proberly need to run network-manager or the nm-applet by hand
lubuntu likes to use wicd last i tried it.  you could try wicd also.
is that a package I will need to install?
if you installed lxde on ubuntu, then the nm-applet  should be installed allready
I've had lxde in the past but i installed lubuntu-desktop, i went without all that this time, so im having to fill in gaps
if you installed lubuntu-desktop package it may of removed network manager and installed wicd. You may want to ask in #lubuntu
I didnt install that, i still have network manager. im in standard ubuntu right now
the have lubuntu launch the nm-applet perhaps.   I forget the name of the binary.
I'm trying installing wicd
that might remove network manager
LBA i recall is needed for large sized hard drives.
So since I'm doing a 3Gb partition on a 4Gb flash drive i can use the regular one?
